title: Robbie Williams wants to put a stop to Michael Buble owning Christmas
text:
Robbie is coming for Buble’s Christmas crown

Robbie Williams might just be the Grinch who stole Christmas after declaring that Michael Buble’s epic Christmas run ‘must end’.

It’s become a tradition that Buble’s iconic 2011 Christmas album plays in every shop and household whether it’s the familiar jingle of It’s Beginning To Look A Lot Like Christmas or the rockin and rollin’ of Santa Claus Is Coming To Town.

Basically, Buble is Christmas.

Which is why it hurts every inch of our soul that Robbie, 45, is threatening to put a stop to it all with his own festive album.

The former Take That singer has announced the release of The Christmas Present as well as a party at Wembley’s SSE Arena in London on 16 December.

It’s all very exciting but it might mean putting an end to Buble’s annual Christmas cheer.

Speaking at a Q&A with Scott Mills, Robbie said according to NME: ‘You’re always looking for a reason to go into the studio.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘And I thought: “Why don’t I own birthdays like Paul McCartney and Stevie Wonder? Or New Year’s Day like… U2?” Well, it’s a bit depressing, that one, isn’t it? You wouldn’t put that one on for a shindig.’

So then he thought of his genius idea: ‘This album was gonna be called Achtung Buble. I fu**ing love Michael, but it must stop. It must end now.’

Yep sorry Robbie, but you’re definitely the Grinch right now. But perhaps there’s room for both to rule our Christmas playlists?

Robbie is certainly making a good effort as The Christmas Present will boast 28 tracks and a host of pretty impressive collaborations.

The Christmas Present is out in November

Sir Rod Stewart, Bryan Adams and Jamie Cullum are among the stars to duet with the popstar. But there’s none more surprising than boxer Tyson Fury who has teamed up with Robbie on the song Bad Sharon, which is about a drunken office party.

Poor Sharon is about to have all the tea spilled about her antics.

In a statement about the record, Robbie said: ‘I’m beyond excited to announce my first ever Christmas album.

‘I’ve done a lot in my career and releasing this record is another dream come true. Making this album has been so much fun and I can’t wait for you all to hear it.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Sounds like a treat, Robster.

The Christmas Present is out on 22 November.

Robbie Williams - The Christmas Present tracklist Disc 1: Christmas Past 1. Winter Wonderland

2. Merry Xmas Everybody featuring Jamie Cullum

3. Let It Snow! Let It Snow! Let It Snow!

4. The Christmas Song (Chestnuts roasting on an open fire)

5. Coco?s Christmas Lullaby

6. Rudolph

7. Yeah! It?s Christmas

8. It?s A Wonderful Life featuring Poppa Pete

9. Let?s Not Go Shopping

10. Santa Baby featuring Helene Fischer

11. Best Christmas Ever

12. One Last Christmas

13. Coco?s Christmas Lullaby Reprise Disc 2: Christmas Future 14. Time For Change

15. Idlewild

16. Darkest Night

17. Fairytales featuring Rod Stewart

18. Christmas (Baby Please Come Home) featuring Bryan Adams

19. Bad Sharon featuring Tyson Fury

20. Happy Birthday Jesus Christ

21. New Year?s Day

22. Snowflakes

23. Home

24. Soul Transmission Bonus tracks 25. I Believe in Father Christmas

26. Not Christmas

27. Merry Kissmas

28. It Takes Two featuring Rod Stewart

description: Robbie Williams has joked that he wants to end Michael Buble's annual festive run with the release of his own Christmas album.
